headline: LUCKHURST: Ruben Amorim has a simple decision to make with Benjamin Sesko in Manchester United vs Arsenal
body: Ruben Amorim might have dropped to his haunches before kick-off if he saw Viktor Gyokeres strolling around the centre circle and Manchester United did not have a new striker in their own half.
But Benjamin Sesko is ready to start. Whether he does will be debated in the pubs around Old Trafford until the team news is published at 3.15pm on Sunday.
Amorim trialled strikerless sides in Manchester United's last two friendlies against Everton and Fiorentina, seemingly preparing a plan B in case Sesko did not arrive in time. He did.

Sesko's private jet touched down at Manchester Airport last Thursday. He was paraded by United on Saturday and trained with his new teammates last Sunday. He has already dined in Spinningfields and San Carlo.
Logic would dictate the new £73.62million striker has to start. "He (Sesko) has great potential," Amorim enthused, "in everything he does.

"He can play different types of football. He’s going to feel that Premier League is really aggressive, he is going to learn but he has great potential. I can see Ben being a striker for Manchester United for a lot of years. That is why we paid so much money, to have a striker to have his history in our club.

"Of course, we didn’t have a lot of time but he’s ready. Physically, he’s ready, that is a big component in our league. Then he is really smart, every detail he asks, he is a guy who is always thinking. He spent all afternoon here working on his fitness, we will see if he is going to play, going to start."

United want players to stay longer in their new £50m Carrington hub to maximise the facilities. Sesko dines in the canteen upstairs and then heads downstairs to the calming treatment room for additional stretches. Amorim raved about Sesko's inquisitiveness.

"I don’t need to tell Ben, 'Ben, this is Manchester United, a lot of pressure, you have to perform, you need to be ready for the physicality, we need to be ready for every game. It’s like do or die'. With that guy, I don’t have that concern. I have the opposite."

It is rare that two of England's biggest clubs are pitted against each other on the opening weekend of a new campaign with new No.9s in their arsenal. The closest in recent memory was Manchester City and Liverpool in the 2022 Community Shield, when Darwin Nunez outshone Erling Haaland. Nunez started on the bench.

Amorim is heavily responsible for Arsenal's £64m outlay on Gyokeres, a goalscorer who came to prominence at Sporting. In an era of exciting Scandinavian strikers, Gyokeres is at Arsenal, City have Haaland and Alexander Isak is burning bridges on the Tyne to get to Liverpool.
Sesko has taken an identical career path to Haaland: from Red Bull Salzburg to Manchester, via budding Champions League qualifiers in the Bundesliga. Downplaying any more comparisons would be wise.

Gyokeres, 27, is five years Sesko's senior but both will be similarly scrutinised. "The physicality is different," Amorim noted. "In Sporting, they have a very good group of scouting because they live from that, from the players that they can buy and then sell to survive.
"He’s a very good player. He’s going to give different characteristics. It’s going to be different if, in the beginning of the game, if we face Viktor or (Kai) Havertz, for example.
"We need to be prepared for that but it's not a surprise to watch Viktor in a big club in England."

United discovered early in the window that Gyokeres was set on joining a Champions League club. His mask celebration is ostensibly inspired by Bane, Batman's antagonist in The Dark Knight Rises. One of the character's first lines in the film is, "Now's not the time for fear, that comes later." United fans had enough fear last season.

United do have a Scandinavian frontman, though it appears unlikely Rasmus Hojlund will get a kick for the club again. With Joshua Zirkzee back in team training, there is a chance Hojlund could be left out altogether from the matchday squad this weekend.

Since Hojlund stopped in the mixed zone in Soldier Field, asked if anyone wanted to talk to him and outlined his intention to stay, Amorim has benched him in both of United's games. Hojlund had a cameo in Atlanta, where he kicked a post in anger. Then he did not get a kick as he warmed the bench against Fiorentina. Hojlund killed time by doing some ball juggling as he warmed up.
Those close to Hojlund conceded he would have to leave now Sesko has come in. Hojlund is open to moving to AC Milan but the topic of his future was given short shrift by Amorim on Friday.
"He’s one more option. We will see. We are focused on this game and Rasmus is still our player."

Zirkzee did not play for United throughout pre-season as he recovered from an injury and his only appearance in the past four months was his desperate emergence from the bench in the Europa League final. Hojlund was at least involved in training in midweek, having not been visible in their post-Fiorentina session.

If Amorim is hesitant about whether to start Sesko, he may want to research how United's recent summer striker signings have fared on home debut. Cristiano Ronaldo, Romelu Lukaku and Zlatan Ibrahimovic each claimed two goals in wins.
Sesko idolises Ibrahimovic. Emulating him on Sunday would lift Amorim from his haunches.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Carlos Baleba latest, Adam Wharton link, David De Gea return
body: Hello and welcome back to the Manchester United transfer blog on Saturday, August 16.

The Premier League got back up and running Friday night with Liverpool beating Bournemouth in an eventful 4-2 victory. If that has whetted your appetite for the return of competitive football, strap yourself in, as you do not have long to wait until the Reds start their campaign against Arsenal.

We shall be previewing the big match today, as well as keeping you up to date with the summer transfer window. MEN Sport understands the move for Carlos Baleba is unlikely to be completed before the deadline, but United are relaxed about the situation and are happy to delay the move until next year.
In the meantime, thoughts turn to who could be United's alternative this summer. Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton is liked by manager Ruben Amorim and is thought to be on the radar.

Murmurs of a return for former goalkeeper David De Gea have also been talked up, with the Spaniard having impressed in a pre-season clash with Fiorentina last weekend. There is also the small matter of sales to discuss with Alejandro Garnacho, Rasmus Hojlund, Antony, Jadon Sancho and Tyrell Malacia all expected to depart before the window closes.
Keep across all the latest United news, views and transfer rumours below...
The Athletic say Rasmus Hojlund's future at Manchester United is now over.
Hojlund has been attracting interest from Italy over the summer, with AC Milan the latest interested party.
But now with the transfer deadline closing in, Ruben Amorim appears to have told the forward that minutes will be hard to come by.

Rasmus Hojlund set to be left out of #MUFC squad v Arsenal. Striker has been told he faces a challenge to get minutes this season under Ruben Amorim.Hojlund has said he wants to stay but several clubs interested in signing him w/ @mjcritchleyhttps://t.co/uWf2K1KDK1
Caught Offside states that Arsenal and Manchester United are keeping tabs on PSG forward Lee Kang-in.
The 24-year-old has been linked to the move away from the French club in recent months and is under contract until 2028.
Arsenal have embodied their interest by making direct contact, whilst United's stance is unknown at present.
Roma have made another approach for a United name, this time it's Tyrell Malacia.
The Netherlands international has struggled for game time since Ruben Amorim's arrival, and is another who is thought to have no future at Old Trafford.
Now, the Serie A side wants to learn the conditions of a deal, with Malacia thought to be keen on the move, Fabrizio Romano has revealed.
Jadon Sancho appears no closer to a summer exit at Manchester United.
Roma have tabled a package worth £20m fee on loan + obligation to buy, but the winger is still contemplating his future.
Besiktas, Juventus and Borussia Dortmund have all appeared to cool their interest, with Ruben Amorim clear that the 25-year-old is not part of his plans.
After seemingly missing out on Carlos Baleba from Brighton, talkSPORT believes Manchester United are keen admirers of Adam Wharton.
The Crystal Palace man missed large parts of the 2024/25 campaign before returning to help Oliver Glasner's side win the FA Cup last season.
United are weighing up whether to test Palace's resolve to keep Wharton after being told Baleba is not for sale.
According to Alan Nixon, Manchester United are considering a shock return for David De Gea.
De Gea, who left United in 2023, was replaced that same summer by Andre Onana, with some sections of the fan base still puzzled by the decision.
United are said to have been 'tipped off' that de Gea has a clause in his deal at Fiorentina that can let him leave for a small sum.
After Brighton's 1-1 draw with Fulham, Manchester United-linked star Carlos Baleba took to social media.
A post shared by Carlos Baleba (@carlos_baleba)
Manchester United are reportedly considering a swap deal with AC Milan.
Rasmus Hojlund is known to be liked by the Serie A outfit, with Mike Maignan now said to be involved in negotiation conversations.

Manchester United are considering including Rasmus Højlund (£38m) in a swap deal with AC Milan for Mike Maignan , eyed as André Onana’s replacement. The French goalkeeper is out of contract in 2026. #MUFC #ManUtd #ACMilan #Maignan #Hojlund #Transfers #EPL #SerieA
Sancho has attracted interest from both Besiktas and Roma.
According to journalist Secan Dikme, via Sports Digitale, Besiktas have given the winger until the end of the weekend to respond to their offer.
However, no details have been provided regarding the nature of that proposal.
Man United-linked Baleba took to social media to share a message after featuring for Brighton in their 1-1 draw with Fulham.
He wrote: "Just me doing the thing I love most. Had fun playing at home with the boys. Nothing new here, just my number and a haircut."
United had identified the youngster as a potential reinforcement, but Brighton’s £100m valuation, and their stance that he is not for sale, has forced United to wait at least another year.
Patrick Dorgu has hinted that he could be in-line for a start on Sunday afternoon when the Premier League returns.

United enter the new season tomorrow, at home to Arsenal, with expectations high. They struggled desperately in the Premier League last campaign after practically giving up on their domestic form to focus on the Europa League.

Ahead of the match, posting on his story, Dorgu shared a custom match graphic for tomorrow afternoon's opener. While not a sure fire sign that he will be starting against the Gunners, players often share these posts on social media when they are all set to feature in some capacity.
It is seen as a subtle nod to family and friends to tune in for the fixture. 2025 has been a break-out year for Dorgu after he was signed from Lecce in January.
Manchester United and Jadon Sancho's working relationship looks all-set to come to an end this summer after a tumultuous couple of years.

Sancho was banished from the first-team under the club's previous manager, Erik ten Hag, after claiming he was a scapegoat for the Dutchman. He joined Borussia Dortmund on loan in January and when he eventually returned to Old Trafford, Ten Hag claimed he had patched things up with the winger.
After a loan spell with Chelsea last season, Sancho informed the club that he wanted to leave this summer and now it is a race against the clock to get that deal done.
Football Italia understand that Hjulmand is one of the midfielders Juventus are interested in signing this summer.

The Danish international has reportedly been on Juventus’ radar since his time at Lecce, before his move to Portugal. The report adds that while Sporting CP are keen to keep their captain until next summer, they may consider selling if a 'suitable offer' comes in.
Having decided against pursuing a deal for Carlos Baleba, United have shifted their focus to Hjulmand, alongside Adam Wharton.
As per Football Insider, former Man United chief scout Mick Brown has confirmed that Maguire will not leave the club this summer.

He claims United have turned down multiple offers from interested parties. "Man United aren’t going to let Maguire leave," he said. "A few clubs have been interested and had made contact to check whether he would be available, but those talks have not been allowed to develop.

"They see Maguire as a very important part of the squad, both on the pitch and off it.He’s played consistently with all sorts of pressure, speculation and issues around him, and he’s come through that and proved himself. From what I hear, Ruben Amorim is a fan of him and he doesn’t want to see him go.

"He’s a leader and an experienced head in the dressing room for the younger players, but he’s also one of their better centre-backs every time he plays. He’s an integral part of what Amorim is looking to do, and there are no plans to let him go. As long as he’s fit, he’s an important part of the squad."
According to Caught Offside, Man United are considering a summer move for Lee Kang-in from Paris Saint-Germain.
The winger is reportedly free to leave due to competition for places in France and has already been in direct contact with Arsenal.
The report claims that it seems the South Korean could also depart alongside Gianluigi Donnarumma, as he is reportedly 'seriously' considering a move before the summer deadline.
It's said that if Chelsea only manage to sell one member of that unwanted trio, Maresca may have to make do with the attacking options currently available to him.
Reports from Portugal (via the Daily Mail) suggest that Gyokeres' representatives were left 'hurt' by the lack of a formal approach from Man United, which came as a surprise at Old Trafford.

From United's perspective, Gyokeres' appearance at the stadium this season was always expected to be in an Arsenal shirt. Mikel Arteta also believed that Gyokeres' preference was clear after just one phone call.
Behind the scenes, it's said that United had no interest in publicly losing a race they were never truly in.
Fabrizio Romano claims Roma are 'still waiting' for Sancho's final decision after putting forward a contract proposal.
Taking to X, Romano added: "United are ready to accept £20m fee on loan + obligation, they want to get it done ASAP. Final green light now up to Jadon."
Betis' No.7 shirt, worn by Antony during his loan from Man United in the second half of last season, is currently unassigned.

Spanish newspaper Marca reports that it will remain so, with no current first-team player expected to take the number. Betis also still have an available non-EU spot, meaning Antony could return easily if a transfer is agreed.
Betis porting director Manu Fajardo has confirmed the Spanish club is not giving up on re-signing the Brazilian. "Both parties want him to be here this season," said Fajardo.

"Every day that passes allows us to dream of him being here. If Antony is here, it's because the numbers add up. The most important thing is the club's sustainability; we can't do anything crazy. It's okay to think big, but you also have to keep your feet on the ground.
"If he doesn't sign with a club, there are still options, but the deal would take place within the parameters we have budgeted at the club."
According to reports in Italy, Sancho's salary demands is a problem for AS Roma.

Italian media believe that the deal is likely to be structured as a loan with an obligation to buy, for a total fee of around €23m. However, Sancho's hefty salary is said to be beyond Roma's means, and the club are proposing a five-year contract to spread the salary over a longer period.
It remains unclear whether he will accept the offer or hold out for more, with interest also coming from Juventus and Besiktas.
Man United are not planning to proceed with a move for Baleba this summer despite being an admirer of the Brighton midfielder.
United first held discussions with Brighton through intermediaries before the two clubs later spoke directly. But the Seagulls made it clear they do not intend to sell Baleba in this transfer window.
The 21-year-old has started for Brighton against Fulham this afternoon.
Both Morten Hjulmand and Adam Wharton have emerged as potential options.
Man United face strong competiton for goalkeeper Senne Lammens.
Providing an update, Fabrizio Romano said on YouTube: "In case they go for a goalkeeper don’t forget the name I gave you in July. Lammens, the young goalkeeper of Royal Antwerp.

"United still like the player, they still have him on their shortlist. They still have to decide whether they want to go for a goalkeeper or not. It will also depend on the budget and the [new] midfielder. So there is a kind of puzzle for Man Utd in these final two weeks of the window, also including Senne Lammens at the moment."
Meanwhile, The Telegraph suggests United must now choose whether to persist with their pursuit of Lammens or change course, as Inter Milan are said to have entered the race 'strongly.'
Reports from Belgium suggested that Antwerp would demand an upfront fee in the region of €15m-€20m (£13m-£17.3m).
According to reports in Portugal, Sporting CP have no intention of selling any more of their key players this summer.

It’s noted that Hjulmand’s €80m (£69m) release clause was only valid until June 15, meaning there is currently no fixed price for the midfielder. As a result, Sporting would now be free to demand whatever fee they see fit.
With Manchester United also exploring alternatives to Carlos Baleba, both Hjulmand and Crystal Palace’s Adam Wharton are believed to be under consideration.

Sporting boss Rui Borges has already issued a warning to interested clubs. Speaking in his press conference this week, he said: "They know the club's plans for potential departures. They [players] have [release] clauses; whoever wants to [sign them] has to trigger those clauses, of course."
Ex-United captain Keane has warned that the price for Baleba's potential may be too high to pay. Speaking to the Stick to Football podcast, Keane said: "I'd be surprised if it happened.

"Because I still think that kid... he's got to do a bit more. You're talking about £100m, but I still think it's potential with a lot of these players. You can't pay £100m for a player where you don't know which way he's going to go."
More here.
Brighton have named Manchester United-linked midfielder Carlos Baleba in the starting XI for this afternoon's Premier League clash against Fulham.
The Seagulls value the midfielder at £115m.
Manchester United reporter Steven Railston has looked at some alternative targets to Carlos Baleba this summer.
Read the full story, here.
After Liverpool and Bournemouth kicked off the new Premier League season last night, there are a further nine games across the next three days.
Here is a full run-down of the fixtures across Saturday, Sunday and Monday:
Aston Villa vs Newcastle
Brighton vs Fulham
Sunderland vs West Ham
Tottenham vs Burnley
Wolverhampton vs Manchester City
Chelsea vs Crystal Palace
Forest vs Brentford
United vs Arsenal
Leeds vs Everton
After being linked with a move to United, it appears the La Liga giants are wanting to snap up another English gem in the form of Crystal Palace's Wharton.
The Daily Mail understands scouts from Madrid have watched Wharton in action and like what they see.
Manchester City are also thought to be looking at Wharton with the Reds believed to be keen too.
Speaking to BetVictor Casino, former Premier League manager Harry Redknapp has urged United to complete sales before the transfer window closes at the beginning of September.

A successful season for Manchester United would be obviously a trophy of some sort but a top six finish would be a massive improvement. Ruben Amorim has got a hard job on his hands but they have brought some decent players in, I think that the recruitment looks like it's okay and they're not finished yet they're gonna bring a few more in so it all depends who they bring in. Really the team needs rebuilding and he needs to get a few out. He's got a few there that he doesn't fancy who are not probably good around the place attitude wise and you know you only need a few bad apples at your club and they can absolutely destroy your football club and it seems to me that he has got one or two there that he feels are bad apples and until he gets them out he's always going to have a problem. He's obviously pushed them to one side. He's not taking players on the trip that he didn't feel were part of what he's looking to do. It's been bold and I like the manager. I think he comes over great, full of enthusiasm and he knows what he wants. But good players are the most important thing. To be a great manager, the most important ingredient is to have great players. Manchester United certainly didn't have great players last year. They were a very, very poor group. Hopefully they are improving this year. I'd love to see them do better.
According to Caught Offside, United are among the clubs looking at PSG midfielder Lee Kang-in.
The attacking midfielder has a contract until 2028 at the French giants and therefore would not be considered an easy or cheap acquisition.
Napoli and Arsenal are also thought to be keen on the 24-year-old with the latter claimed to have made direct contact for the South Korean.

headline: LUCKHURST: Ruben Amorim admits Manchester United have to 'fight' fan feeling at Old Trafford
body: Ruben Amorim admitted Manchester United supporters will still succumb to nerves during their home games this season.
United won only seven of their Premier League matches at Old Trafford last term as they were beaten nine times, the most home league losses they have suffered since 1962-63.

Amorim has changed United's pre-match routine for home games and they will no longer arrive at Old Trafford four hours before kick-off, a measure introduced by Erik ten Hag in 2022. The players will instead maximise the facilities at United's new £50million hub at Carrington that opened last week.

United drew with Fiorentina in their only pre-season friendly but went 1-0 down in the first half. Despite a markedly different makeup of matchgoers for a friendly, Amorim felt they felt "nervous" after Fiorentina scored direct from a corner in the eighth minute.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

"That is really important," Amorim said of the need to improve the home form. "We don't have to think about it. It's just one game against Arsenal. Against one team that everyone in this room thinks Arsenal is going to win.
"It's not a mental thing. It's not just for the players. It's also for the fans. Even the game against Fiorentina. You can feel it. The fans are a little bit nervous.

"This feeling you cannot... it's not just one day, one game [and it's gone]. So it's a feeling that we have to fight everyone together. The players, the coaches and the fans. And we are going to change things.
"If you want to win things and to be a very strong team, especially at home, you need to win your games."
Manchester United have unveiled their new third kit for the 2025/26 season.

Benjamin Sesko, Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo could all start and make their debut for United vs Arsenal. Sesko is yet to feature for United following his £74million move from RB Leipzig last week with fellow forwards Cunha and Mbeumo getting some game-time in the club's pre-season friendlies.

headline: David De Gea to Man United transfer return claim made as Carlos Baleba alternative emerges
body: Amie is a football writer covering clubs across the country, she has been a football fan all of her life and supports Leicester City. She graduated with a degree in Sport and Exercise Psychology in 2015. Amie has previous experience in local radio in Leicester and Leicestershire.
Manchester United start their 2025/2026 Premier League season on Sunday afternoon as they take on Arsenal at Old Trafford (4.30pm).

The game could see three major summer arrivals make their competitive debut for Ruben Amorim's side. Matheus Cunha, Bryan Mbeumo and Benjamin Sesko have all completed moves to Old Trafford this summer and will look to make an instant impact.
Despite the new campaign getting underway, there are still a couple of weeks of the transfer window remaining. Clubs have until 7pm on September 1 to complete their business.
United are "making checks" on a possible shock return for David De Gea - according to Alan Nixon of The Sun.

The report says that the goalkeeper has a clause in his contract with Fiorentina that allows him to leave the club for a small sum. That's reckoned to have alerted United, who have some concerns over their goalkeeping options.
It's said that United may need either Andre Onana or Altay Bayindir to leave to free up wages.
However, a compromise could be found if a deal to bring De Gea back is cheap enough financially.
The Spaniard is said to be happy to be either first pick or to provide competition in the goalkeeping department, which is another positive for a move.

However, if a deal is a cheap one to do, and De Gea is available at a low price, then it could be something that United consider with the Spaniard providing competition to Onana, who is only just returning from injury just in time for their season to start.
A return would be an emotional on for the club and the player, with De Gea admitting that he wouldn't play for any other English team.
United have identified Crystal Palace and England midfielder Adam Wharton as a possible transfer alternative to Carlos Baleba this summer, according to talkSPORT.
The report says that United are now "weighing up" whether to try and test Palace's resolve by making a bid.
United have, effectively, walked away from a potential deal for Baleba this summer - after being told by Brighton that he's not for sale. But hope remains on his signature moving forward.
United are said to be long-term admirers of Wharton, who's helped Palace win both the FA Cup and Community Shield in the last few months.
Both Eberechi Eze and Marc Guehi have been heavily linked with exits to Tottenham and Liverpool, respectively. United could, therefore, have their work cut out if they are to convince Palace to sell.

headline: Gary Neville speechless as Benjamin Sesko fear called out in Man United claim
body: Gary Neville was rendered speechless when Ian Wright highlighted a concerning scenario regarding Manchester United signing Benjamin Sesko.

The Slovenia international joined from RB Leipzig for an initial £66.4million with additional fees totalling approximately £7.6m. Sesko is an exciting prospect, but his youthful inexperience and United's poor return of scoring 44 Premier League goals last term means doubts are persisting over his potential impact.

Rather than concentrating purely on Sesko, Neville also discussed fellow summer arrivals Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo, setting the trio a collective target of 35 goals. Wright challenged this observation, noting how earlier in their discussion, Neville had suggested Viktor Gyokeres' inaugural Arsenal campaign would prove disappointing should he net merely 10 Premier League goals.
During the latest Stick to Football podcast, Neville initiated the debate by saying: "Sesko, we know less about him. Obviously, we've seen bits about him.
"We've seen centre-forwards come to United over the last six, seven or eight seasons and it's not been easy. There is going to be pressure on him, obviously [Rasmus] Hojlund is still there."
Wright subsequently responded: "The thing as well with him is that he scored 13 goals in 33 Bundesliga appearances last season. [Omar] Marmoush left in December and had 15.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.
"That says to me as a striker he should be scoring more at that level. I think like Gyokeres, he has got such great ability and physicality, I think he will get 15 goals."
Neville subsequently claimed a haul of between "10 or 13" goals would represent success for Sesko, assuming Mbeumo and Cunha contribute the remaining 25 goals between them.

Yet Wright challenged the former United skipper's assessment, drawing comparisons with the significantly higher expectations he'd established for Gyokeres. The Arsenal legend said: "What if Sesko only scored 10?
"Seriously, what if he only got 10. You just turned your nose up when I mentioned Gyokeres potentially only getting 10 and now you're thinking about Sesko only getting 10."

Despite Neville highlighting Gyokeres is more experienced than Sesko, Wright wouldn't allow him to escape scrutiny. The former England defender then attempted to construct an argument by saying: "I think 10..." before finding himself rendered speechless by his own contemplations.

Whilst Wright turned towards Jamie Carragher, Jill Scott and Roy Keane, Neville said: "The reason I am stuttering is because I'm wondering how Cunha and Mbeumo are going to do. If he scores 10 and the others can chip in with 12 a piece, I would still say 35 from the three of them is massive."

When Wright pressed him further regarding his suggestion 10 goals for Gyokeres would fall well short, Neville replied: "The reason I said that is because I think Arsenal will create so many more chances. They will have so much more play.

"They are a much better team. He (Gyokeres) is going to be in a better team. He's going to get more chances. Sesko is not going to get as many chances as Gyokeres. That is where I would be at with it."

headline: Roy Keane lays down Benjamin Sesko challenge amid Manchester United summer transfer verdict
body: Former Manchester United captain Roy Keane has thrown down a challenge for new signing Benjamin Sesko - to score on his debut, which could potentially be against Arsenal this afternoon.

Ruben Amorim's first starting XI will be announced before kick-off against the Gunners at Old Trafford and the name supporters are hopeful of seeing is Sesko's. The 22-year-old striker completed a transfer from RB Leipzig last weekend and Sunday will be his first opportunity to play.
He followed Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha through the entrance as United have reshaped their attack force for a total £207.5m over the summer.
Now the challenge will be score more than the 44 goals United's players collectively managed in the Premier League last season.

"The biggest problem they had all last season despite chatting about the goalkeeper, the defence, they didn’t score enough goals. When you’re not scoring enough goals, particularly when Manchester United invested so much money, you’re constantly under so much pressure."

The United legend-turned-pundit began to have his say on the club's summer business, suggesting he is largely impressed with what he has seen. He added: "Obviously tried to fix that this summer and the new signings, looking at them in pre-season I know it’s still early but yeah, the signs are good.

"They’ve obviously brought two players in who know the Premiership, they’re robust enough to deal with the challenge. Obviously they needed a goalscorer, they were constantly under pressure. Looking at it, I like the look of it."
Keane lay down his challenge for Sesko, to get up and running as soon as possible and hopefully score against old foes Arsenal on the opening weekend of the season.

The 54-year-old added: "This is a big start. We saw players already putting a marker down this weekend so for any striker, Sesko, who goes to a new club, if he’s starting can he get up and running? Score a goal? Get that trust and belief not only from supporters of the club but from his teammates."

headline: Benjamin Sesko drops Manchester United team news hint after Ruben Amorim admission
body: Manchester United summer signing Benjamin Sesko could make his debut for the club against Arsenal and the Slovenian has posted a hint ahead of their Premier League opener. Ruben Amorim's side take on last season's top-flight runners-up in the fixture of the weekend ahead of an important campaign.

The Gunners targeted Sesko before they turned their attention to Viktor Gyokeres, and the 22-year-old could come back to haunt Mikel Arteta after completing his move from RB Leipzig last week. However, United landed their target after beating Newcastle United to his signature.
Following last season's poor performance in the Premier League, there will be an added focus on United's showing in the top-flight as they look to bounce back from the 15th-place finish.
Sesko could be handed his debut on Sunday and he posted on social media ahead of the showdown at Old Trafford.
Players often post to their social media channels ahead of matches and it doesn't always necessarily mean they will be handed a start or even included in the squad.
But the United boss hinted that he could be handed his bow in a United shirt, he said: "He hasn't had a lot of time, [but] physically he's ready. He's really smart, a guy who's always thinking.
"He is ready to play but we'll see if he's going to start. I think he has great potential in everything he does.

“He can play different types of football. He's going to feel that the Premier League is really aggressive, he's going to learn, but he has a great potential and I can see Ben being a striker for Manchester United for a lot of years.

“That's why we paid so much money - to have a striker that will have his history in our club. The guy is always thinking about football. He's really obsessed by that and that is a good thing because you don't have to think about that aspect with that young guy.
“I don't need to tell Ben, 'this is Manchester United, a lot of pressure, you have to perform, you need to be ready for the physicality, we need to be ready for every game, it's like do-or-die'.
“With that guy, I have not that concern. I have the opposite, [he needs to] enjoy [himself] a little bit. He's listening, and he wants to perform, so that is really good."

headline: Manchester United quintet drop Ruben Amorim team news hints amid Arsenal selection headache
body: Ruben Amorim will be hoping for an opening-weekend scalp as Manchester United host Arsenal at Old Trafford. United's summer clearout has proved positive thus far, despite only Marcus Rashford having completed an exit at present.

Antony, Jadon Sancho, Tyrell Malacia and Alejandro Garnacho are still on the hunt for new clubs, with the latter said to have accepted a proposal from Chelsea. Sancho and Malacia are both liked by AS Roma, with the quartet set to play no part in today's clash with the Gunners.

Despite that, the mood at Carrington has been lifted, with Amorim having installed a better culture over the summer. Benjamin Sesko, Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha are all in line to make their respective Premier League debuts for the Red Devils, with intrigue surrounding the Red Devils' team selection.
Multiple players have already taken to social media with the 4:30pm kick-off closing in, dropping hints about their possible inclusiong in the starting XI.

Diogo Dalot and Leny Yoro are among those to share graphics on their social media ahead of the game. Of course, this does not mean they'll start the game, but it does offer a big hint that they'll be in the matchday squad.
Yoro will likely start in a back three alongside Matthijs de Ligt, although it is still unknown whether Luke Shaw or Ayden Heaven will accompany the pair.
Casemiro is in line to partner Bruno Fernandes in midfield, with the Brazilian also posting a matchday graphic on Instagram, which could provide another clue.
Patrick Dorgu is another to have done so, with the Danish international a likely option over on the left-hand side of Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system.
Finally, Bryan Mbeumo is surely a shoo-in over in the right number 10 spot, with Cunha and Sesko the most likely pair to accompany him in attack.
Andre Onana will hope to overcome a late fitness test to start in between the sticks, despite having played 0 minutes across all five of United's pre-season games.

headline: Man United eye game-changing PSG transfer deal as Jadon Sancho update emerges
body: Manchester United have just over two weeks left to complete their summer transfer business, at which point the window will close until the New Year.

It's already been a busy summer for United, with three new signings being confirmed over the last couple of months. Benjamin Sesko became United's third signing of the summer last week, with Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo also completing moves to Old Trafford.

All three players could be included in Ruben Amorim's starting line-up to face Arsenal on Sunday afternoon. There are also rumours that United could still make further new signings before the transfer window closes.
United are reportedly showing an interest in signing Paris Saint-Germain star Lee Kang-in.
Caught Offside have reported that United are joined by Arsenal and Napoli in expressing an interest in the South Korea international, who could leave PSG before the transfer window closes.
The report claims that PSG would be open to letting Lee leave the club this summer, provided they receive an offer that meets their valuation.

MEN Sport says: This is the first time that Lee has been linked with United, and it remains to be seen if there's any truth to the rumour. If United were to sign Lee, who plays as a winger or in a No.10 position for PSG, it would be interesting to see what fee the Ligue 1 club would demand for his signature.
A fresh update has emerged about Jadon Sancho's future amid interest from Roma.
Transfer specialist Fabrizio Romano has reported that United are ready to finalise a move for Sancho to join Roma on loan with an obligation to make the move permanent next summer for £20million.
However, the report claims that Sancho has yet to make a decision on joining Roma, which is currently what is holding up the deal from being completed.

MEN Sport says: Sancho has been linked with a move away from United for some time, ever since he informed the club of his desire to leave earlier in the summer. It now seems a matter of time before United agree a deal for Sancho to leave Old Trafford before the September 1 deadline.

headline: Breakout Man United star drops early team news hint as Ruben Amorim plan vs Arsenal emerges
body: Manchester United wing-back Patrick Dorgu has hinted that he could be in-line for a start on Sunday afternoon when the Premier League returns.

United enter the new season tomorrow, at home to Arsenal, with expectations high. They struggled desperately in the Premier League last campaign after practically giving up on their domestic form to focus on the Europa League.

This would ultimately backfire as United lost 1-0 to Tottenham Hotspur in the competition's final in Bilbao, ensuring that they would be without European football this season. With their focus, now, solely on the Premier League and English cup competitions, there are no excuses for United to not improve drastically.

In the summer window, United have bolstered their attack with three new additions, while Diego Leon has been signed to provide cover at left wing-back. It seems that the Reds will be sticking with Leon's teammate Dorgu on the left flank for the start of the season, though, should his Instagram activity be anything to go by.

Posting on his story, Dorgu shared a custom match graphic for tomorrow afternoon's opener. While not a sure fire sign that he will be starting against the Gunners, players often share these posts on social media when they are all set to feature in some capacity.
It is seen as a subtle nod to family and friends to tune in for the fixture. 2025 has been a break-out year for Dorgu after he was signed from Lecce in January.

He made his debut on the right flank for the Reds in the FA Cup, but he soon transitioned on to the left. He would only miss two Premier League games following his arrival due to suspension and also featured heavily in the run to the Europa League final vs Tottenham.

headline: Man United left 'surprised' after hearing Viktor Gyokeres transfer admission
body: Manchester United were reportedly left surprised after hearing suggestions that Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokeres was hurt by the lack of interest in him from the Reds this summer.

During his time at Sporting Lisbon, the Swede became a talisman as he scored 97 goals in 102 appearances for the club. Most of those goals were bagged while Ruben Amorim was in the hot seat at the Portuguese club.
However, when the Reds swooped in to hire Amorim following Erik ten Hag's departure, the rumour mill soon began. With United needing a new No.9, it was expected that they would bid for Gyokeres.

Said bid never arrived with MEN Sport understanding that United felt it would be futile to move for the striker as his heart was set on the Emirates Stadium. However, the Daily Mail has reported on Saturday evening that they were taken aback when Gyokeres felt disappointed that his old boss did not try to sign him.
In his pre-match press conference at Carrington, Amorim was quizzed on Gyokeres but decided to keep his reply brief. "That is a question for Mikel [Arteta]," he explained.

"Viktor is in a different league. Sporting have good scouting because they live from the players they can buy and sell to survive.
"I think he’s a very good player. It’s not a surprise to see him with a big club in England."

Of course, United would eventually splash the cash on RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko who, ironically enough, was a target for Arsenal both this year and last. Speaking on his new centre-forward, Amorim said: "I think he has great potential in everything he does.

headline: Gary Neville continues Nottingham Forest feud after Man United decision and Sky Sports comment
body: Former Manchester United captain Gary Neville has continued his feud with Premier League club Nottingham Forest after hinting that he may have an opinion to express on the team next week.

It is understood that while he is not officially banned from the East Midlands club, Forest have no plans to welcome him until an agreement has been reached over his attitude towards the club's owner Evangelos Marinakis. Neville has been critical of the owner, most recently following the draw against Leicester City where he described it as 'scandalous' that Marinakis entered the field of play at full-time.

A conversation was had between Marinakis and his head coach Nuno Espirito Santo on the pitch. Forest later released an indirect statement calling on ex-players not to spread 'fake news online' after the insinuation was made that Marinakis entered the field of play to confront the manager.

Forest claim the owner had actually entered the field of play to check on the wellbeing of forward Taiwo Awoniyi who picked up a serious injury. In a bid to stir the pot on Friday night, Jamie Carragher asked Neville if he would be in the East Midlands this weekend as Sky cover Forest's opener against Brentford.

headline: Carlos Baleba decision made amid Man United transfer stance
body: Carlos Baleba has been named in Brighton's first starting line-up of the Premier League season following links to Manchester United during the summer transfer window.
Having spent almost £200m on the attacking trio of Benjamin Sesko, Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha, United would be prepared to delay chasing a deal until next year.

So it is business as usual for the midfield star and his current club, Brighton, who begin their Premier League campaign at home to Fulham at 3pm on Saturday. Baleba missed three pre-season fixtures due to injury but has been passed fit enough to return for the start of the season.
He begins in a midfield defensive midfield two alongside Yasin Ayari, taking the place of Diego Gomez, who started the Seagull's latest pre-season friendly against Wolfsburg.
Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler had been asked about Baleba and outside transfer interest before the match.
"Very, very, very confident (he will stay)," the manager told the media attending his press conference, adding: "It's just my belief.
"I didn't see any change in him. He only changed his hair, that was the only change he made in the last two weeks!
"But overall, he seems to be in a really good place. He's enjoying it with his team-mates. He's enjoying being a Brighton player.
"He's very grateful to have the progress he made in the last season. I didn't see any big change. He is an option to start for tomorrow."
Baleba himself suggested he is focused, posting a picture of himself in training with his current club in the build-up to the Premier League's opening weekend.

headline: RAILSTON: Manchester United fans split on ownership ahead of 2025/2026 season
body: Manchester United fans are split on the club's ownership ahead of the new Premier League season.
Sir Jim Ratcliffe acquired a minority stake at Old Trafford in February 2024. The British billionaire gained control of football operations and has overseen several controversial decisions.
The decision to raise matchday ticket prices to £66 per game in the Premier League last season, with no concessions for children or pensioners, triggered intense backlash from fans.
United suffered their worst campaign for 51 years, finishing 15th in the Premier League, and a handful of protests were organised against the ownership throughout the season.
United supporter group The 1958 announced a fresh protest before facing Arsenal on Sunday, but they have decided to postpone the protest after gauging fan opinion on the issue.

Ruben Amorim has been backed with the arrivals of Matheus Cunha, Bryan Mbeumo, Benjamin Sesko and Diego Leon. The mood has improved after an encouraging pre-season, which has contributed to the split in opinion.
Betfair’s annual Nation Predicts survey of more than 2,000 football fans, conducted by YouGov Sport, touched on ownership and 59 per cent of United fans said they were not happy.
The 1958 protest group conducted their own research (with 26,000 responses) and further highlighted how fans are undecided about whether to give Ineos more time to prove themselves.

When The 1958 announced the protest before the opening day of the season would be postponed, they said: "After careful reflection, and in light of the survey results. We have made the decision to postpone the planned protest for the Arsenal home game on Saturday, August 17th.

"For us, it has always been, and will always be, about the fans. About how we’re treated by the club and its owners. About protecting the future of Manchester United, affordable football for all (especially youth), safeguarding fan culture, and ensuring the next generation of supporters inherit a club run with responsibility and respect.
"These long-term goals matter more to us than signings, glittery training ground refurbs or anything else. That’s where we’ve always stood and we make no apologies for it.

"With a fanbase as diverse and passionate as ours, finding the right balance isn’t always easy. We’ve had to consider momentum, timing, fan appetite, broader consequences of protest activity whilst assessing how current and future decisions may impact us as fans.
"Given the current sentiment within the fanbase and particularly in light of these recent survey results, it’s clear there is no unified view on the direction of the club under Ratcliffe.
"That split is real, and we believe it would be irresponsible to risk creating a situation that could result in any “red on red” conflict inside or outside the stadium."
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

headline: Carlos Baleba to Man United transfer latest - Brighton decision, deal timeline, new 'stance'
body: Manchester United have been heavily linked with Carlos Baleba this summer, but a deal for the Brighton & Hove Albion midfielder may have to wait until next year.

Meanwhile, The Athletic understands that Baleba remains keen on a move to United, but he's willing to be patient and wait until next year if necessary. The player's willingness to join Old Trafford should give the Reds an edge over other clubs next summer.
Baleba was named in Brighton's first starting line-up of the Premier League season.
After spending nearly £200million, on a new attacking trio of Benjamin Sesko, Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha, United appear willing to wait until next year to pursue a move.

Speaking on his YouTube channel, Fabrizio Romano said: "Brighton closed the doors to the exit of Baleba this summer. Manchester United will keep Carlos Baleba on their list - Man Utd will maintain that name in internal conversations.

"If it's not going to happen this summer, Man Utd will still consider Carlos Baleba as their target for 2026, I can guarantee that. Man Utd love the player and really appreciate how he was keen on the move even in a difficult moment for United."
Speaking before Brighton's match with Fulham, the Seagulls boss said: "Very, very, very confident [he will stay]. It's just my belief. I didn't see any change in him.

"He only changed his hair, that was the only change he made in the last two weeks! But, overall, he seems to be in a really good place. He's enjoying it with his teammates. He's enjoying being a Brighton player. He's very grateful to have the progress he made in the last season. I didn't see any change."

headline: Man Utd: Amorim ‘sends clear message’ to Red Devils star as Romano confirms ‘it’s definitely over’
body: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has reportedly ‘sent a clear message’ to one current player ahead of Sunday’s match against Arsenal.
The Red Devils have had a decent summer transfer window as they have overhauled their attack by signing Benjamin Sesko, Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha.
However, Man Utd have not managed to offload as many unwanted talents as they would have liked in this window, with Marcus Rashford their only major departure.

Alejandro Garnacho and Jadon Sancho could be the next out the door amid interest from Chelsea and AS Roma respectively, while Rasmus Hojlund is looking increasingly likely to join United’s bomb squad members in leaving.
READ: Five reasons why Man Utd away is a nightmare first game for Arteta and Arsenal
Hojlund’s form fell off a cliff after he enjoyed a strong debut season at Old Trafford, as he struggled to do the basics and looked devoid of all confidence during the 2024/25 campaign.
The struggling striker has been heavily linked with an exit this summer and it’s been reported that club chiefs are pushing for him to leave following the arrival of Sesko.

Now, Hojlund’s exit appears to have moved a step closer as The Athletic‘s Laurie Whitwell revealed on Sunday afternoon that he will not feature against Arsenal in United’s first game of the 2025/26 season.
“Rasmus Hojlund set to be left out of #MUFC squad v Arsenal. Striker has been told he faces a challenge to get minutes this season under Ruben Amorim,” Whitwell said on X.
“Hojlund has said he wants to stay but several clubs interested in signing him.”

Fabrizio Romano, meanwhile, claims “it’s dehttps://www.football365.com/news/premier-league-sack-race-arteta-amorim-nunofinitely over” for Hojlund at Man Utd, with the striker set to “assess his options”.
Romano tweeted: “Rasmus Højlund and Manchester United, it’s definitely over.
“Højlund won’t be part of Man United squad against Arsenal as club sends clear message pushing for his exit.
“United open to permanent and also loan deal, Højlund will assess his options — follows @lauriewhitwell.”
Hojlund’s exit should boost Man Utd’s chances of landing a new midfielder and Romano has named a potential alternative to Brighton’s Carlos Baleba.
“Man Utd could go for midfielder Morten Hjulmand from Sporting. Obviously, Ruben Amorim knows the player so well. He’s always been appreciated by Amorim, but there are two points,” Romano said.
“Sporting don’t want to sell other top players after losing Viktor Gyokeres this summer. It will be a tough and difficult deal.
“Second point: Manchester United have not started concrete talks with him. They’re informed about the situation because it’s a player who’s always been in their list.

“One of the players they have been following. But they’re not advanced for several reasons, including their focus on Carlos Baleba and because they still want to understand what kind of player they really want to sign.”
Transfer expert Fabrizio Romano has revealed Arsenal’s next “big mission” as they look to avoid selling a key star to Real Madrid.
Premier League side Fulham are interested in signing Man Utd striker Rasmus Hojlund this summer as they look for a goalscorer, according to reports.
Transfer expert Fabrizio Romano has revealed that Alejandro Garnacho’s potential transfer from Man Utd to Chelsea is now ‘very, very advanced’.
Fabrizio Romano has confirmed that Manchester United have received a £20million offer from Roma for out-of-favour winger Jadon Sancho.
Man Utd are closing in on their latest outgoing this summer with West Brom closing in on a season-long loan deal for Toby Collyer, according to reports.
Parma centre-back Giovanni Leoni is heading to Liverpool to have his ‘medical’ on Merseyside ‘today’, according to transfer expert Fabrizio Romano.
